import fitz
import PDFbf

# Filepath
filepath = "RQ67WXP.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Task 1: Line, Cross mode, page 4, rectangle 3 (repair)
pagenumber1 = 3  # Page 4 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder1 = 2
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1)
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
intersected_lines = selector1.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

drawing_manipulator1 = PDFbf.draw_drawer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, listofcdraw=intersected_lines)
doc = drawing_manipulator1.delete_draw()

repairer1 = PDFbf.repairer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"), cdrawings=selector1.selected_lines, sel_drawings=intersected_lines)
doc = repairer1.del_repair()

# Task 2: Column, Window mode, page 5, rectangle 6 (repair)
pagenumber2 = 4  # Page 5 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder2 = 5
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle2)
selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
covered_columns = selector2.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

drawing_manipulator2 = PDFbf.draw_drawer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, listofcdraw=covered_columns)
doc = drawing_manipulator2.delete_draw()

repairer2 = PDFbf.repairer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2.get("clip"), cdrawings=selector2.selected_lines, sel_drawings=covered_columns)
doc = repairer2.del_repair()

# Task 3: Rebar, Cross mode, page 6, rectangle 2
pagenumber3 = 5  # Page 6 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder3 = 1
rectangle3, rfpoint3 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber3, rectangleorder=rectangleorder3)

doc = drawing_manipulator3.delete_draw()

# Save updated file

doc.save(updatedfilepath)

instruction:
In file M1T8LKP.pdf, modify the graphics:
On page 4, rectangle 2, rotate the line class counterclockwise by 15 degrees using intersect mode.
On page 6, rectangle 7, scale the column class to 0.9 size using cover mode.
On page 10, rectangle 5, translate the rebar and line classes downward by 30 units using intersect mode.
ground_truth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "M1T8LKP.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Operation 1: Page 4, rectangle 2, rotate lines counterclockwise by 15 degrees using intersect mode
pagenumber1 = 3  # Page 4 corresponds to pagenumber=3 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder1 = 1  # Rectangle 2 corresponds to rectangleorder=1
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

argument1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    rotation=['r', -15, rfpoint1]  # Rotate counterclockwise by 15 degrees
)

selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
intersected_lines = selector1.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

projector1 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=intersected_lines,
    cdrawings=selector1.selected_lines,
    rotation=argument1.get("rotation")
)
doc = projector1.project()

# Operation 2: Page 6, rectangle 7, scale columns to 0.9 size using cover mode
pagenumber2 = 5  # Page 6 corresponds to pagenumber=5 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder2 = 6  # Rectangle 7 corresponds to rectangleorder=6
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

argument2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle2,
    scal=['sc', [0.9, 0.9], rfpoint2]  # Scale to 0.9 size
)

selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
covered_columns = selector2.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

projector2 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber2,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_columns,
    cdrawings=selector2.selected_lines,
    scal=argument2.get("scal")
)
doc = projector2.project()

# Operation 3: Page 10, rectangle 5, translate rebars and lines downward by 30 units using intersect mode
pagenumber3 = 9  # Page 10 corresponds to pagenumber=9 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder3 = 4  # Rectangle 5 corresponds to rectangleorder=4
rectangle3, rfpoint3 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber3, rectangleorder=rectangleorder3)

argument3 = dict(
    clip=rectangle3,
    move=[0, -30, rfpoint3]  # Translate downward by 30 units
)

selector3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber3, clip=argument3.get("clip"))
intersected_rebars = selector3.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
intersected_lines = selector3.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

# Apply operations to rebars
projector3_rebars = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber3,
    clip=argument3.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=intersected_rebars,
    cdrawings=selector3.selected_lines,
    move=argument3.get("move")
)
doc = projector3_rebars.project()

# Apply operations to lines
projector3_lines = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber3,
    clip=argument3.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=intersected_lines,
    cdrawings=selector3.selected_lines,
    move=argument3.get("move")
)
doc = projector3_lines.project()

# Save the updated file

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: RX27B.pdf
filepath = "RX27B.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Page 4, Rectangle 2
pagenumber = 3  # Page 4 corresponds to 3 in zero-based indexing
rectangleorder = 1  # Second rectangle corresponds to 1 in zero-based indexing
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Assume reasonable values for unspecified attributes
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    arrange=[[20, 25, 30], [35, 40, 45]],  # Varied row heights and column widths
    fontsize=12,  # Medium font size
    align="center"  # Center alignment
)

# Extract table and update
table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))
table_data = table_extractor.data

Table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=table_data,
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize"),
    align=argument.get("align")
)
doc = Table_manipulator.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

# File: ZT93N.pdf

)

)
doc = Table_manipulator.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the files
filepath1 = "T8L2MRK.pdf"
doc1 = fitz.open(filepath1)

filepath2 = "R4N6PLY.pdf"
doc2 = fitz.open(filepath2)

# Extract rectangles and reference points
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc1)
pagenumber1 = 0
rectangleorder1 = 3
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc2)
pagenumber2 = 7
rectangleorder2 = 9
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Create a selector for the first file
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=rectangle1)
rebar1 = selector1.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
projector1 = PDFbf.project_draw(doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=rectangle1, sel_drawings=rebar1, cdrawings=selector1.selected_lines, move=[0, 20, rfpoint1])
doc1 = projector1.project()

# Create a selector for the second file
selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=rectangle2)
lines2 = selector2.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
columns2 = selector2.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
projector2 = PDFbf.project_draw(doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=rectangle2, sel_drawings=lines2 + columns2, cdrawings=selector2.selected_lines, scal=['sc', [0.8, 0.8], rfpoint2])
doc2 = projector2.project()

# Save the updated files
updatedfilepath1 = filepath1[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc1.save(updatedfilepath1)

updatedfilepath2 = filepath2[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc2.save(updatedfilepath2)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Object 1: "A1BC23.pdf", Page 3, Rectangle 2
filepath1 = "A1BC23.pdf"
doc1 = fitz.open(filepath1)
annoextractor1 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc1)
pagenumber1 = 2  # Page 3 (0-based index)
rectangleorder1 = 1  # Rectangle 2 (0-based index)
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor1.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: "line" vectors, Window mode
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1, drwcolor="red", width=1.5)
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
covered_lines = selector1.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=covered_lines, 
                                     drwcolor=argument1.get("drwcolor"), width=argument1.get("width"))
doc1 = manipulator1.update_draw()

# Group 2: "rebar" vectors, Cross mode
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle1, fillcolor="blue", dashes="[3 3]0")
selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
intersected_rebars = selector2.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=intersected_rebars, 
                                     fillcolor=argument2.get("fillcolor"), dashes=argument2.get("dashes"))
doc1 = manipulator2.update_draw()

# Group 3: "column" vectors, Window mode
argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle1, lineJoin=1, width=2.0)
selector3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument3.get("clip"))
covered_columns = selector3.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=covered_columns, 
                                     lineJoin=argument3.get("lineJoin"), width=argument3.get("width"))
doc1 = manipulator3.update_draw()
updated_file1 = filepath1[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc1.save(updated_file1)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: LF78K.pdf
filepath = "LF78K.pdf"

# Page 6, Rectangle 8

rectangleorder = 7  # Eighth rectangle corresponds to 7 in zero-based indexing
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

    clip=rectangle,
    arrange=[[25, 28], [40, 45]],  # Slightly increased row heights and proportional column widths
    font="Times New Roman",  # Commonly used font in technical documents
    align="left"  # Typical alignment
)

    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=table_data,
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    align=argument.get("align")
)
doc = Table_manipulator.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: BG62P.pdf
filepath = "BG62P.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Page 2, Rectangle 7
pagenumber = 1  # Page 2 corresponds to 1 in zero-based indexing
rectangleorder = 6  # Seventh rectangle corresponds to 6 in zero-based indexing
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Assume reasonable values for unspecified attributes
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    arrange=[[22, 24, 26], [35, 35]],  # Average row height and column width
    fontsize=12,  # Commonly used font size
    align="justify"  # Alignment for readability
)

# Extract table and update
table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))
table_data = table_extractor.data

Table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=table_data,
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize"),
    align=argument.get("align")
)
doc = Table_manipulator.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the files
filepath1 = "R6N8LKP.pdf"
doc1 = fitz.open(filepath1)

filepath2 = "M5L3TPY.pdf"
doc2 = fitz.open(filepath2)

# Extract rectangles and reference points
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc1)
pagenumber1 = 9
rectangleorder1 = 2
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc2)
pagenumber2 = 0
rectangleorder2 = 5
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Create a selector for each file
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=rectangle1)
selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=rectangle2)

# Scale the line class in R6N8LKP.pdf
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1, scal=['sc', [1.1, 1.1], rfpoint1])
selector1.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
projector1 = PDFbf.project_draw(doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"), sel_drawings=selector1.selected_lines, cdrawings=selector1.selected_lines, scal=argument1.get("scal"))
doc1 = projector1.project()

# Translate the column and rebar classes upward by 30 units in M5L3TPY.pdf
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle2, move=[0, 30, rfpoint2])
selector2.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
selector2.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
projector2 = PDFbf.project_draw(doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2.get("clip"), sel_drawings=selector2.selected_columns + selector2.selected_rebars, cdrawings=selector2.selected_columns + selector2.selected_rebars, move=argument2.get("move"))
doc2 = projector2.project()

# Save the updated files
updatedfilepath1 = filepath1[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc1.save(updatedfilepath1)

updatedfilepath2 = filepath2[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc2.save(updatedfilepath2)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: TD49X.pdf
filepath = "TD49X.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Page 14, Rectangle 4
pagenumber = 13  # Page 14 corresponds to 13 in zero-based indexing
rectangleorder = 3  # Fourth rectangle corresponds to 3 in zero-based indexing
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Assume reasonable values for unspecified attributes
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    arrange=[[22, 24, 26], [40, 45]],  # Subtly varied row heights and balanced column widths
    font="Georgia",  # Popular serif font
    borderwidth=1  # Thin border
)

# Extract table and update
table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))
table_data = table_extractor.data

Table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=table_data,
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    borderwidth=argument.get("borderwidth")
)
doc = Table_manipulator.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: VP75Z.pdf
filepath = "VP75Z.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Page 8, Rectangle 9
pagenumber = 7  # Page 8 corresponds to 7 in zero-based indexing
rectangleorder = 8  # Ninth rectangle corresponds to 8 in zero-based indexing
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Assume reasonable values for unspecified attributes
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    arrange=[[22, 22, 22], [40, 40]],  # Typical row heights and column widths
    font="Arial",  # Standard font
    borderwidth=2  # Noticeable but not thick border
)

# Extract table and update
table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))
table_data = table_extractor.data

Table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=table_data,
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    borderwidth=argument.get("borderwidth")
)
doc = Table_manipulator.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

On page 3, for the first rectangle: Replace the cells from the 6th row and 6th column to the 8th row and 8th column with new data: first row: "A, B, C", second row: "1, 2, 3", third row: "X, Y, Z." Delete the 4th column. Clear the range from the 2nd row and 2nd column to the 5th row and 3rd column.
On page 3, for the second rectangle: Replace the first two rows with new data: first row: "Header1, Header2," second row: "Value1, Value2."
Delete the 3rd row. Clear the cells starting from the 1st row and 1st column to the 3rd row and 4th column.
On page 3, for the third rectangle: Replace the 1st row with new data: "X, Y."
Set the font to "Arial."
ground_truth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level
filepath = "DesignPlan_4732.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Page-level
pagenumber = 2  # Page 3 corresponds to pagenumber = 2

# Task 1: Updates in the first rectangle
rectangleorder1 = 0  # First rectangle corresponds to rectangleorder = 0
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1, font="Arial")
table_extractor1 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
table_data1 = table_extractor1.data

table_manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument1.get("clip"), data=table_data1, font=argument1.get("font")
)

# Replace cells
replace_data1 = [["A", "B", "C"], ["1", "2", "3"], ["X", "Y", "Z"]]
table_manipulator1.data = table_manipulator1.modifytable(repdata=replace_data1, startcell=[6, 6], endcell=[8, 8])

# Delete 4th column
table_manipulator1.data = table_manipulator1.cuttable(delcolumn=[4])

# Clear a specific range
table_manipulator1.data = table_manipulator1.emptytable(startcell=[2, 2], endcell=[5, 3])

doc = table_manipulator1.addtable()

# Task 2: Updates in the second rectangle
rectangleorder2 = 1  # Second rectangle corresponds to rectangleorder = 1
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle2)
table_extractor2 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
table_data2 = table_extractor2.data

table_manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument2.get("clip"), data=table_data2,  font="Arial"
)

# Replace first two rows
replace_data2 = [["Header1", "Header2"], ["Value1", "Value2"]]
table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.modifytable(repdata=replace_data2, startcell=[1, "all"], endcell=[2, "all"])

# Delete 3rd row
table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.cuttable(delrow=[3])

# Clear a specific range
table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.emptytable(startcell=[1, 1], endcell=[3, 4])

doc = table_manipulator2.addtable()

# Task 3: Updates in the third rectangle
rectangleorder3 = 2  # Third rectangle corresponds to rectangleorder = 2
rectangle3, rfpoint3 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder3)

argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle3)
table_extractor3 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument3.get("clip"))
table_data3 = table_extractor3.data

table_manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument3.get("clip"), data=table_data3, font="Arial"
)

# Replace specific range with new data
replace_data3 = [["X", "Y"]]
table_manipulator3.data = table_manipulator3.modifytable(repdata=replace_data3, startcell=[1, "all"])

doc = table_manipulator3.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)
output_code:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File path
filepath = "DesignPlan_4732.pdf"

# Open the file
doc = fitz.open(filepath)
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page 3
pagenumber = 3

# Rectangle 1
rectangleorder1 = 0
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1)
table_extractor1 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
table_data1 = table_extractor1.data
table_manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument1.get("clip"), data=table_data1)
table_manipulator1.data = table_manipulator1.modifytable(repdata=[["A, B, C"], ["1, 2, 3"], ["X, Y, Z"]], startcell=[5, 5], endcell=[7, 7])
table_manipulator1.data = table_manipulator1.cuttable(delcolumn=[3])
table_manipulator1.data = table_manipulator1.emptytable(startcell=[1, 1], endcell=[4, 2])
doc = table_manipulator1.addtable()

# Rectangle 2
rectangleorder2 = 1
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle2)
table_extractor2 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
table_data2 = table_extractor2.data
table_manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument2.get("clip"), data=table_data2)
table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.modifytable(repdata=[["Header1, Header2,"], ["Value1, Value2"]], startcell=[0, 0], endcell=[1, 1])
table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.cuttable(delrow=[2])
table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.emptytable(startcell=[0, 0], endcell=[2, 3])
doc = table_manipulator2.addtable()

# Rectangle 3
rectangleorder3 = 2
rectangle3, rfpoint3 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder3)
argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle3)
table_extractor3 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument3.get("clip"))
table_data3 = table_extractor3.data
table_manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument3.get("clip"), data=table_data3)
table_manipulator3.data = table_manipulator3.modifytable(repdata=[["X, Y"]], startcell=[0, 0], endcell=[0, 0])
table_manipulator3.data = table_manipulator3.set_font("Arial")
doc = table_manipulator3.addtable()

updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

instruction: Edit the table in MQ24T.pdf, on page 5, in the 1st rectangle. Adjust the three column widths to have minor variation and three row heights to a suitable average size. Use a default font style and align the text casually.
ground_truth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: MQ24T.pdf
filepath = "MQ24T.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Page 5, Rectangle 1
pagenumber = 4  # Page 5 corresponds to 4 in zero-based indexing
rectangleorder = 0  # First rectangle corresponds to 0 in zero-based indexing
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Assume reasonable values for unspecified attributes
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    arrange=[[24, 26, 28], [35, 36, 37]],  # Minor variations in column widths and suitable row heights
    font="Helvetica",  # Default font style
    align="left"  # Casual alignment
)

# Extract table and update
table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))
table_data = table_extractor.data

Table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=table_data,
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    align=argument.get("align")
)
doc = Table_manipulator.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

instruction:
In file A7L2KMQ.pdf, perform the following operations:
On page 3, rectangle 4:
Group 1: Translate the line class upward by 20 units using cover mode.
Group 2: Rotate the column class clockwise by 45 degrees using cover mode.
Group 3: Scale the rebar class to 1.1 size using cover mode.
On page 6, rectangle 2:
Group 1: Translate the line and column classes downward by 30 units using cover mode.
ground_truth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "A7L2KMQ.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page 3, rectangle 4
pagenumber1 = 2  # Page 3 corresponds to pagenumber=2 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder1 = 3  # Rectangle 4 corresponds to rectangleorder=3
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: Translate line class upward by 20 units using cover mode
argument1_group1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    move=[0, 20, rfpoint1]
)
selector1_group1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1_group1.get("clip"))
covered_lines = selector1_group1.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
projector1_group1 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1_group1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines,
    cdrawings=selector1_group1.selected_lines,
    move=argument1_group1.get("move")
)
doc = projector1_group1.project()

# Group 2: Rotate column class clockwise by 45 degrees
argument1_group2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    rotation=['r', 45, rfpoint1]
)
selector1_group2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1_group2.get("clip"))
covered_columns = selector1_group2.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
projector1_group2 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1_group2.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_columns,
    cdrawings=selector1_group2.selected_lines,
    rotation=argument1_group2.get("rotation")
)
doc = projector1_group2.project()

# Group 3: Scale rebar class to 1.1 size
argument1_group3 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    scal=['sc', [1.1, 1.1], rfpoint1]
)
selector1_group3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1_group3.get("clip"))
covered_rebars = selector1_group3.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
projector1_group3 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1_group3.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_rebars,
    cdrawings=selector1_group3.selected_lines,
    scal=argument1_group3.get("scal")
)
doc = projector1_group3.project()

# Page 6, rectangle 2
pagenumber2 = 5  # Page 6 corresponds to pagenumber=5 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder2 = 1  # Rectangle 2 corresponds to rectangleorder=1
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Group 1: Translate line and column classes downward by 30 units
argument2_group1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle2,
    move=[0, -30, rfpoint2]
)
selector2_group1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2_group1.get("clip"))
covered_lines = selector2_group1.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
covered_columns = selector2_group1.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

# Apply operations to lines
projector2_group1_lines = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber2,
    clip=argument2_group1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines,
    cdrawings=selector2_group1.selected_lines,
    move=argument2_group1.get("move")
)
doc = projector2_group1_lines.project()

# Apply operations to columns
projector2_group1_columns = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber2,
    clip=argument2_group1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_columns,
    cdrawings=selector2_group1.selected_lines,
    move=argument2_group1.get("move")
)
doc = projector2_group1_columns.project()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: XL53C.pdf
filepath = "XL53C.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Page 10, Rectangle 10
pagenumber = 9  # Page 10 corresponds to 9 in zero-based indexing
rectangleorder = 9  # Tenth rectangle corresponds to 9 in zero-based indexing
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Assume reasonable values for unspecified attributes
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    arrange=[[25, 28, 30], [40, 40, 40]],  # Consistent column widths and moderately increased row heights
    font="Calibri",  # Legible font for professional presentations
    align="center"  # Alignment appropriate for professional presentations
)

# Extract table and update
table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))
table_data = table_extractor.data

Table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=table_data,
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    align=argument.get("align")
)
doc = Table_manipulator.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

rectangleorder1 = 3  # Rectangle 4 (0-based index)
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: "rebar" vectors, Cross mode
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1, drwcolor="brown", width=2.0)

                                     drwcolor=argument1.get("drwcolor"), width=argument1.get("width"))

# Group 2: "column" vectors, Window mode
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle1, fillcolor="gray", lineCap=1)

manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=covered_columns, 
                                     fillcolor=argument2.get("fillcolor"), lineCap=argument2.get("lineCap"))

# Group 3: "line" vectors, Cross mode
argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle1, dashes="[0 0]0", width=1.6)
selector3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument3.get("clip"))
intersected_lines = selector3.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=intersected_lines, 
                                     dashes=argument3.get("dashes"), width=argument3.get("width"))
doc = manipulator3.update_draw()

# Object 2: Rectangle 9

doc = manipulator5.update_draw()

# Group 3: "column" vectors, Window mode

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level
filepath = "GH12A.pdf"

# Page-level

    clip=rectangle,
    text="Sectional Views",
    font="times-roman",  # Assuming "times-roman" for high legibility
    textcolor="gray",  # Understated color for subtlety
    rotate=10  # Subtle rotation
)

    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    text=argument.get("text"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize"),
    textcolor=argument.get("textcolor"),
    rotate=argument.get("rotate")
)
doc = Text_manipulator.addtext()

# Save updated file

doc.save(updatedfilepath)

instruction:
In file L9T4MKP.pdf, execute these tasks:
On page 4, rectangle 5:
Group 1: Rotate the coveredcolumn class clockwise by 60 degrees.
Group 2: Translate the intersected line class downward by 15 units.
Group 3: Scale the covered rebar and line classes to 1.2 size.
ground_truth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "L9T4MKP.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page 4, rectangle 5
pagenumber = 3  # Page 4 corresponds to pagenumber=3 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder = 4  # Rectangle 5 corresponds to rectangleorder=4
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Group 1: Rotate column class clockwise by 60 degrees
argument_group1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    rotation=['r', 60, rfpoint]
)
selector_group1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument_group1.get("clip"))
covered_columns = selector_group1.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
projector_group1 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument_group1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_columns,
    cdrawings=selector_group1.selected_lines,
    rotation=argument_group1.get("rotation")
)
doc = projector_group1.project()

# Group 2: Translate line class downward by 15 units
argument_group2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    move=[0, -15, rfpoint]
)
selector_group2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument_group2.get("clip"))
covered_lines = selector_group2.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
projector_group2 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument_group2.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines,
    cdrawings=selector_group2.selected_lines,
    move=argument_group2.get("move")
)
doc = projector_group2.project()

# Group 3: Scale rebar and line classes to 1.2 size
argument_group3 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    scal=['sc', [1.2, 1.2], rfpoint]
)
selector_group3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument_group3.get("clip"))
covered_rebars = selector_group3.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
covered_lines = selector_group3.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

# Apply operations to rebars
projector_group3_rebars = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument_group3.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_rebars,
    cdrawings=selector_group3.selected_lines,
    scal=argument_group3.get("scal")
)
doc = projector_group3_rebars.project()

# Apply operations to lines
projector_group3_lines = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument_group3.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines,
    cdrawings=selector_group3.selected_lines,
    scal=argument_group3.get("scal")
)
doc = projector_group3_lines.project()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

import PDFbf

pagenumber = 4
rectangleorder = 5
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)
argument = dict(clip=rectangle)
selector = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))

projector3 = PDFbf.project_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument3.get("clip"), sel_drawings=covered_rebars3 + covered_lines3, cdrawings=selector.selected_lines, scal=argument3.get("scal"))

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: R3N6TLP.pdf
filepath1 = "R3N6TLP.pdf"
doc1 = fitz.open(filepath1)

# Initialize annotation extractor for R3N6TLP.pdf
annoextractor1 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc1)

# Page 7, rectangle 8
pagenumber1 = 6  # Page 7 corresponds to pagenumber=6 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder1 = 7  # Rectangle 8 corresponds to rectangleorder=7
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor1.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: Translate rebar class upward by 40 units using cover mode
argument1_group1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    move=[0, 40, rfpoint1]
)
selector1_group1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1_group1.get("clip"))
covered_rebars = selector1_group1.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
projector1_group1 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc1,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1_group1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_rebars,
    cdrawings=selector1_group1.selected_lines,
    move=argument1_group1.get("move")
)
doc1 = projector1_group1.project()

# Group 2: Scale column and line classes to 1.1 size
argument1_group2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    scal=['sc', [1.1, 1.1], rfpoint1]
)
selector1_group2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1_group2.get("clip"))
covered_columns = selector1_group2.mode2_columns_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
covered_lines = selector1_group2.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

# Apply operations to columns
projector1_group2_columns = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc1,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1_group2.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_columns,
    cdrawings=selector1_group2.selected_lines,
    scal=argument1_group2.get("scal")
)
doc1 = projector1_group2_columns.project()

# Apply operations to lines
projector1_group2_lines = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc1,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1_group2.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines,
    cdrawings=selector1_group2.selected_lines,
    scal=argument1_group2.get("scal")
)
doc1 = projector1_group2_lines.project()

updated_filepath1 = filepath1[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc1.save(updated_filepath1)

# File: A5L2KMQ.pdf
filepath2 = "A5L2KMQ.pdf"
doc2 = fitz.open(filepath2)

# Initialize annotation extractor for A5L2KMQ.pdf
annoextractor2 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc2)

# Page 10, rectangle 3

rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor2.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Group 1: Rotate line class counterclockwise by 15 degrees

    clip=rectangle2,
    rotation=['r', -15, rfpoint2]
)
selector2_group1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2_group1.get("clip"))
covered_lines = selector2_group1.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

Group 2: Select "rebar" class vectors using Window mode. Set fill color to blue and line joint type to sharp.
Group 3: Select "line" class vectors using Cross mode. Set line end type to semi-circle and stroke width to 1.7 pt.
Object 2: In "H8MN34.pdf," page 9, rectangle 6.
Group 1: Select "rebar" class vectors using Window mode. Set stroke color to green and stroke width to 2.3 pt.

Group 3: Select "line" class vectors using Window mode. Set line joint type to cut-off and ensure paths are closed.

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open and process "G5KL12.pdf"
filepath1 = "G5KL12.pdf"
doc1 = fitz.open(filepath1)
annoextractor1 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc1)

# Object 1: Page 5, Rectangle 1
pagenumber1 = 4  # Page 5 (0-based index)
rectangleorder1 = 0  # Rectangle 1 (0-based index)
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor1.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: "column" vectors, Cross mode
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1, drwcolor="red", width=2.1)
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
intersected_columns = selector1.mode2_columns_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=intersected_columns, 
                                     drwcolor=argument1.get("drwcolor"), width=argument1.get("width"))
doc1 = manipulator1.update_draw()

# Group 2: "rebar" vectors, Window mode
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle1, fillcolor="blue", lineJoin=0)
selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
covered_rebars = selector2.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=covered_rebars, 
                                     fillcolor=argument2.get("fillcolor"), lineJoin=argument2.get("lineJoin"))
doc1 = manipulator2.update_draw()

# Group 3: "line" vectors, Cross mode
argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle1, lineCap=1, width=1.7)
selector3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument3.get("clip"))
intersected_lines = selector3.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=intersected_lines, 
                                     lineCap=argument3.get("lineCap"), width=argument3.get("width"))
doc1 = manipulator3.update_draw()

updated_file1 = filepath1[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc1.save(updated_file1)

# Open and process "H8MN34.pdf"
filepath2 = "H8MN34.pdf"
doc2 = fitz.open(filepath2)
annoextractor2 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc2)

# Object 2: Page 9, Rectangle 6
pagenumber2 = 8  # Page 9 (0-based index)
rectangleorder2 = 5  # Rectangle 6 (0-based index)
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor2.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Group 1: "rebar" vectors, Window mode
argument4 = dict(clip=rectangle2, drwcolor="green", width=2.3)
selector4 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument4.get("clip"))
covered_rebars = selector4.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator4 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, sel_drawings=covered_rebars, 
                                     drwcolor=argument4.get("drwcolor"), width=argument4.get("width"))
doc2 = manipulator4.update_draw()

# Group 2: "column" vectors, Cross mode
argument5 = dict(clip=rectangle2, fillcolor="yellow", dashes="[3 3]0")
selector5 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument5.get("clip"))
intersected_columns = selector5.mode2_columns_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator5 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, sel_drawings=intersected_columns, 
                                     fillcolor=argument5.get("fillcolor"), dashes=argument5.get("dashes"))
doc2 = manipulator5.update_draw()

# Group 3: "line" vectors, Window mode
argument6 = dict(clip=rectangle2, lineJoin=2, closePath=True)
selector6 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument6.get("clip"))
covered_lines = selector6.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator6 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, sel_drawings=covered_lines, 
                                     lineJoin=argument6.get("lineJoin"), closePath=argument6.get("closePath"))
doc2 = manipulator6.update_draw()

updated_file2 = filepath2[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc2.save(updated_file2)

instruction:
In file M7T8LRP.pdf, perform these modifications:
On page 6, rectangle 9:
Group 1: Translate the intersected column class downward by 35 units.
Group 2: Rotate the crossed rebar class clockwise by 90 degrees.
Group 3: Scale the line class to 0.85 size.
ground_truth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "M7T8LRP.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page 6, rectangle 9
pagenumber = 5  # Page 6 corresponds to pagenumber=5 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder = 8  # Rectangle 9 corresponds to rectangleorder=8
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Group 1: Translate column class downward by 35 units
argument_group1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    move=[0, -35, rfpoint]
)
selector_group1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument_group1.get("clip"))
covered_columns = selector_group1.mode2_columns_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
projector_group1 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument_group1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_columns,
    cdrawings=selector_group1.selected_lines,
    move=argument_group1.get("move")
)
doc = projector_group1.project()

# Group 2: Rotate rebar class clockwise by 90 degrees
argument_group2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    rotation=['r', 90, rfpoint]
)
selector_group2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument_group2.get("clip"))
covered_rebars = selector_group2.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
projector_group2 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument_group2.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_rebars,
    cdrawings=selector_group2.selected_lines,
    rotation=argument_group2.get("rotation")
)
doc = projector_group2.project()

# Group 3: Scale line class to 0.85 size
argument_group3 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    scal=['sc', [0.85, 0.85], rfpoint]
)
selector_group3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument_group3.get("clip"))
covered_lines = selector_group3.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
projector_group3 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument_group3.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines,
    cdrawings=selector_group3.selected_lines,
    scal=argument_group3.get("scal")
)
doc = projector_group3.project()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

instruction: Update the horizontal-orientated text in rectangle 3 on page 8 of Design_DEF456.pdf, changing the text color; alter the text in rectangle 5 on page 9, setting the general font size; and modify the vertical-orientated text in rectangle 7 on page 10, adjusting the font to formal font.

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 1: Common setup
filepath = "Design_DEF456.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Task 1.1: Rectangle 3 on page 8, horizontal-oriented text, changing the text color to default (black)
pagenumber1 = 7  # Page 8 in 0-indexed format
rectangleorder1 = 2  # Rectangle 3 in 0-indexed format
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1, textcolor="black")  # Default assumed color

Text_manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_text(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    textcolor=argument1.get("textcolor")
)
Text_manipulator1.text = Text_manipulator1.gethortext()
doc = Text_manipulator1.addtext()

# Task 1.2: Rectangle 5 on page 9, setting the general font size to default (12pt)
pagenumber2 = 8  # Page 9 in 0-indexed format
rectangleorder2 = 4  # Rectangle 5 in 0-indexed format
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle2, fontsize=12)  # Default font size assumed

Text_manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_text(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber2,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    fontsize=argument2.get("fontsize")
)
Text_manipulator2.text = Text_manipulator2.gethortext()
doc = Text_manipulator2.addtext()

# Task 1.3: Rectangle 7 on page 10, vertical-oriented text, adjusting the font to a formal font (Times New Roman)
pagenumber3 = 9  # Page 10 in 0-indexed format
rectangleorder3 = 6  # Rectangle 7 in 0-indexed format
rectangle3, rfpoint3 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber3, rectangleorder=rectangleorder3)
argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle3, rotate=90, font="Times New Roman")  # Formal font assumed

Text_manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_text(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber3,
    clip=argument3.get("clip"),
    rotate=argument3.get("rotate"),
    font=argument3.get("font")
)
Text_manipulator3.text = Text_manipulator3.getvertext()
doc = Text_manipulator3.addtext()

# Save the updated file
updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "UV12WX.pdf"

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information for Rectangle 6 on Page 5

rectangleorder = 5  # Sixth rectangle (0-based index)

    data=[
        ["Pipe", "Diameter", "Material"],
        ["P1", "100mm", "PVC"],
        ["P2", "150mm", "HDPE"]
    ],

)

    pagenumber=pagenumber,

    data=argument.get("data"),
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file

# File-level information

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information for Rectangle 7 on Page 10
pagenumber = 9  # Page 10 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 6  # Seventh rectangle (0-based index)

argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Wall", "Length", "Height"],
        ["W1", "10m", "3m"],
        ["W2", "15m", "4m"]
    ],
    arrange=[None, [60, 70, 60]]  # Specifying appropriate column widths
)

# Adding the table

    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    arrange=argument.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

In files B8N6KLR.pdf and C5P4LQM.pdf, apply these modifications:
In B8N6KLR.pdf, on page 3, rectangle 5:
Group 1: Rotate the column class counterclockwise by 45 degrees using cover mode.
Group 2: Scale the line and rebar classes to 0.9 size.
In C5P4LQM.pdf, rectangle 7:
Group 1: Translate the rebar class rightward by 20 units.
ground_truth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: B8N6KLR.pdf
filepath1 = "B8N6KLR.pdf"
doc1 = fitz.open(filepath1)

# Initialize annotation extractor for B8N6KLR.pdf
annoextractor1 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc1)

# Page 3, rectangle 5
pagenumber1 = 2  # Page 3 corresponds to pagenumber=2 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder1 = 4  # Rectangle 5 corresponds to rectangleorder=4
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor1.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: Rotate column class counterclockwise by 45 degrees using cover mode
argument_group1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    rotation=['r', -45, rfpoint1]
)

# Initialize vector selector for Group 1
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument_group1.get("clip"))
covered_columns = selector1.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

# Apply operation to column class
projector1 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc1,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument_group1.get("clip"),

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "QR12ST.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Extract the rectangles on the target page and order
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Get the second page
pagenumber = 1

# Get the second rectangle on the second page
rectangleorder = 1
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Add the table
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

On page 14, for the third rectangle:
Delete the 3rd and 5th rows. Replace the range from the 1st row and 1st column to the 2nd row and 2nd column with new data: "P, Q," "R, S."
Clear the 4th column. Align the text to the left.
On page 15, for the second rectangle:
Replace the first three rows with new data: "HeaderX, HeaderY, HeaderZ," "1, 2, 3," "A, B, C." Clear the range from the 6th row and 5th column to the 7th row and 6th column.

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level
filepath = "SiteLayout_9876.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)


pagenumber1 = 11
rectangleorder1 = 0
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1)
table_extractor1 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
table_data1 = table_extractor1.data

table_manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    data=table_data1,
    fontsize=11
)

replace_data1 = [["ItemA", "ItemB", "ItemC"], ["10", "20", "30"]]
table_manipulator1.data = table_manipulator1.modifytable(repdata=replace_data1, startcell=[1, "all"], endcell=[2, "all"])
table_manipulator1.data = table_manipulator1.cuttable(delcolumn=[4])
table_manipulator1.data = table_manipulator1.emptytable(startcell=[2, 2], endcell=[5, 3])
doc = table_manipulator1.addtable()

pagenumber2 = 13  
rectangleorder2 = 2  
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle2)
table_extractor2 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
table_data2 = table_extractor2.data

table_manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber2,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    data=table_data2,
    align="left"
)

# Delete the 3rd and 5th rows
table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.cuttable(delrow=[3, 5])

# Replace a specific range with new data
replace_data2 = [["P", "Q"], ["R", "S"]]
table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.modifytable(repdata=replace_data2, startcell=[1, 1], endcell=[2, 2])

# Clear the 4th column
table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.emptytable(startcell=["all", 4])

doc = table_manipulator2.addtable()

# Task 3: Updates for the second rectangle on page 15
pagenumber3 = 14  # Page 15 corresponds to pagenumber = 14
rectangleorder3 = 1  # Second rectangle corresponds to rectangleorder = 1
rectangle3, rfpoint3 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber3, rectangleorder=rectangleorder3)

argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle3)

table_manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber3, clip=argument3.get("clip"), data=table_data3)

replace_data3 = [["HeaderX", "HeaderY", "HeaderZ"], ["1", "2", "3"], ["A", "B", "C"]]

table_manipulator3.data = table_manipulator3.emptytable(startcell=[6, 5], endcell=[7, 6])

doc = table_manipulator3.addtable()

# Save the updated file

doc.save(updatedfilepath)

import PDFbf

filepath1 = "A3UV67.pdf"
filepath2 = "B5WX89.pdf"

doc2 = fitz.open(filepath2)

# Object 1
pagenumber1 = 2
rectangleorder1 = 4
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: Select "line" class vectors using Window mode
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1, drwcolor="red", width=2.0)
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
covered_lines1 = selector1.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=covered_lines1, drwcolor=argument1.get("drwcolor"), width=argument1.get("width"))
doc1 = manipulator1.update_draw()

# Group 2: Select "rebar" class vectors using Cross mode
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle1, fillcolor="blue")
selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
intersected_rebars2 = selector2.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=intersected_rebars2, fillcolor=argument2.get("fillcolor"))
doc1 = manipulator2.update_draw()

# Group 3: Select "column" class vectors using Window mode
argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle1, drwcolor="green", lineJoin=0)
selector3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument3.get("clip"))
covered_columns3 = selector3.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=covered_columns3, drwcolor=argument3.get("drwcolor"), lineJoin=argument3.get("lineJoin"))
doc1 = manipulator3.update_draw()

# Object 2
pagenumber2 = 6
rectangleorder2 = 0
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Group 1: Select "rebar" class vectors using Cross mode
argument4 = dict(clip=rectangle2, drwcolor="black", width=2.5)
selector4 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument4.get("clip"))
intersected_rebars4 = selector4.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator4 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, sel_drawings=intersected_rebars4, drwcolor=argument4.get("drwcolor"), width=argument4.get("width"))
doc2 = manipulator4.update_draw()

# Group 2: Select "line" class vectors using Window mode
argument5 = dict(clip=rectangle2, fillcolor="orange", dashes="[3,3]0")
selector5 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument5.get("clip"))
covered_lines5 = selector5.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator5 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, sel_drawings=covered_lines5, fillcolor=argument5.get("fillcolor"), dashes=argument5.get("dashes"))
doc2 = manipulator5.update_draw()

# Group 3: Select "column" class vectors using Window mode
argument6 = dict(clip=rectangle2, drwcolor="black", lineCap=1, width=2.2)
selector6 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument6.get("clip"))
covered_columns6 = selector6.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator6 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, sel_drawings=covered_columns6, drwcolor=argument6.get("drwcolor"), lineCap=argument6.get("lineCap"), width=argument6.get("width"))
doc2 = manipulator6.update_draw()

updatedfilepath1 = filepath1[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc1.save(updatedfilepath1)

updatedfilepath2 = filepath2[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc2.save(updatedfilepath2)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 1: Common setup
filepath = "Drawing_JKL012.pdf"

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Task 1.1: Rectangle 15 on page 12, setting the font size smaller (10pt assumed)
pagenumber1 = 11  # Page 12 in 0-indexed format
rectangleorder1 = 14  # Rectangle 15 in 0-indexed format
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1, fontsize=10)  # Smaller font size assumed

    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    fontsize=argument1.get("fontsize")
)
Text_manipulator1.text = Text_manipulator1.gethortext()
doc = Text_manipulator1.addtext()

# Task 1.2: Rectangle 16 on page 13, changing the alignment to center
pagenumber2 = 12  # Page 13 in 0-indexed format
rectangleorder2 = 15  # Rectangle 16 in 0-indexed format
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle2, align=fitz.TEXT_ALIGN_CENTER)

Text_manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_text(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber2,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    align=argument2.get("align")
)
Text_manipulator2.text = Text_manipulator2.gethortext()
doc = Text_manipulator2.addtext()

# Task 1.3: Rectangle 17 on page 14, vertical-oriented text, setting the font to Verdana
pagenumber3 = 13  # Page 14 in 0-indexed format
rectangleorder3 = 16  # Rectangle 17 in 0-indexed format
rectangle3, rfpoint3 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber3, rectangleorder=rectangleorder3)
argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle3, rotate=90, font="Verdana")  # New font assumed

    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber3,
    clip=argument3.get("clip"),
    rotate=argument3.get("rotate"),
    font=argument3.get("font")
)
Text_manipulator3.text = Text_manipulator3.getvertext()
doc = Text_manipulator3.addtext()

# Save the updated file
updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "OP34QR.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information for Rectangle 2 on Page 6
pagenumber = 5  # Page 6 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 1  # Second rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# First table content
argument1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Beam ID", "Length", "Material"],
        ["B101", "6m", "Steel"],
        ["B102", "8m", "Concrete"]
    ],
    arrange=[None, [70, 60, 80]],  # Adjusting column widths as necessary
    fontsize=11  # Standard font size
)

# Adding the first table
table_adder1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    data=argument1.get("data"),
    arrange=argument1.get("arrange"),
    fontsize=argument1.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder1.addtable()

# Second table content
argument2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Load Type", "Magnitude", "Direction"],
        ["Uniform Load", "5 kN/m", "Downward"],
        ["Point Load", "10 kN", "Upward"]
    ],
    arrange=[[30, 25, 25], None]  # Adjusting row heights as necessary
)

# Adding the second table
table_adder2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    data=argument2.get("data"),
    arrange=argument2.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder2.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: D9T7PLM.pdf
filepath = "D9T7PLM.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page 2, rectangle 3
pagenumber1 = 1  # Page 2 corresponds to pagenumber=1 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder1 = 2  # Rectangle 3 corresponds to rectangleorder=2
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: Translate the line class upward by 25 units using intersect mode
argument_group1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    move=[0, 25, rfpoint1]
)

# Initialize vector selector for Group 1
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument_group1.get("clip"))
intersected_lines = selector1.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

# Apply operation to line class
projector1 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument_group1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=intersected_lines,
    cdrawings=selector1.selected_lines,
    move=argument_group1.get("move")
)
doc = projector1.project()

missing_info1 = '''file-level: D9T7PLM.pdf, page-level: 2, order-level: 3, base-level: Rotate the column class clockwise by 60 degrees (incomplete)'''
recorder1 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_info1)
recorder1.recording()

missing_info2 = '''file-level: D9T7PLM.pdf, page-level: 2, order-level: 3, base-level: Scale the rebar class (incomplete)'''
recorder2 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_info2)
recorder2.recording()

missing_info3 = '''file-level: D9T7PLM.pdf, page-level: 4, order-level: 6, base-level: Translate the column class downward (incomplete)'''
recorder3 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_info3)
recorder3.recording()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

# Assume reasonable values for unspecified attributes

    clip=rectangle1,
    arrange=[[24, 26, 28], [40, 40]],  # Typical column and row spacing

)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level
filepath = "BridgeDesign_1425.pdf"

Delete the 3rd column. Clear the range from the 2nd row and 1st column to the 4th row and 2nd column.'''
recorder_task1 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_info_task1)

rectangleorder2 = 1  # Second rectangle corresponds to rectangleorder = 1

    data=table_data2
)

table_manipulator2.data = table_manipulator2.cuttable()
doc = table_manipulator2.addtable()

import fitz

# Filepath
filepath = "PL49BKM.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Task 1: Rebar, Column, Line, Cross mode, page 3, rectangle 2 (repair)
pagenumber1 = 2  # Page 3 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder1 = 1
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1)
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
intersected_rebars = selector1.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
intersected_columns = selector1.mode2_columns_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
intersected_lines = selector1.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

sel_drawings1 = intersected_rebars + intersected_columns + intersected_lines
drawing_manipulator1 = PDFbf.draw_drawer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, listofcdraw=sel_drawings1)
doc = drawing_manipulator1.delete_draw()

repairer1 = PDFbf.repairer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"), cdrawings=selector1.selected_lines, sel_drawings=sel_drawings1)
doc = repairer1.del_repair()

# Task 2: Column, Line, Rebar, Window mode, page 4, rectangle 5

rectangleorder2 = 4

covered_lines = selector2.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
covered_rebars = selector2.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

drawing_manipulator2 = PDFbf.draw_drawer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, listofcdraw=sel_drawings2)
doc = drawing_manipulator2.delete_draw()

updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

Group 1: Scale the line class to 1.1 size using cover mode.

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: E6N3PLQ.pdf
filepath1 = "E6N3PLQ.pdf"
doc1 = fitz.open(filepath1)

# Initialize annotation extractor for E6N3PLQ.pdf
annoextractor1 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc1)

# Page 5, rectangle 2
pagenumber1 = 4  # Page 5 corresponds to pagenumber=4 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder1 = 1  # Rectangle 2 corresponds to rectangleorder=1
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor1.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: Scale the line class to 1.1 size using cover mode
argument_group1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    scal=['sc', [1.1, 1.1], rfpoint1]
)

# Initialize vector selector for Group 1
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument_group1.get("clip"))
covered_lines = selector1.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

# Apply operation to line class
projector1 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc1,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument_group1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines,
    cdrawings=selector1.selected_lines,
    scal=argument_group1.get("scal")
)
doc1 = projector1.project()

# Group 2: Rotate the rebar class missing necessary rotation details
missing_info1 = '''file-level: F7K4LPM.pdf, page-level: 8, order-level: 9, base-level: Rotate the rebar class (incomplete)'''
recorder1 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_info1)
recorder1.recording()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath1 = filepath1[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc1.save(updated_filepath1)


# File: F7K4LPM.pdf
filepath2 = "F7K4LPM.pdf"
doc2 = fitz.open(filepath2)

# Initialize annotation extractor for F7K4LPM.pdf
annoextractor2 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc2)


# Page 8, rectangle 9
pagenumber2 = 7  # Page 8 corresponds to pagenumber=7 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder2 = 8  # Rectangle 9 corresponds to rectangleorder=8
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor2.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

missing_info2 = '''file-level: E6N3PLQ.pdf, page-level: 8, order-level: 9, base-level: Translate the column class downward by 40 units. (incomplete)'''
recorder2 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_info2)
recorder2.recording()

# Group 2: Rotate the line class clockwise by 30 degrees using intersect mode
argument_group2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle2,
    rotation=['r', 30, rfpoint2]
)

# Initialize vector selector for Group 2
selector3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc2, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument_group2.get("clip"))
intersected_lines = selector3.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

# Apply operation to line class
projector3 = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc2,
    pagenumber=pagenumber2,
    clip=argument_group2.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=intersected_lines,
    cdrawings=selector3.selected_lines,
    rotation=argument_group2.get("rotation")
)
doc2 = projector3.project()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath2 = filepath2[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc2.save(updated_filepath2)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "AB90CD.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information for Rectangle 1 on Page 12
pagenumber = 11  # Page 12 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 0  # First rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# First table content
argument1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Equipment ID", "Power Rating", "Voltage"],
        ["E401", "10 kW", "400V"],
        ["E402", "15 kW", "400V"]
    ],
    arrange=[None, [90, 90, 70]]  # Adjusting column widths accordingly
)

# Adding the first table
table_adder1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    data=argument1.get("data"),
    arrange=argument1.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder1.addtable()

    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Cable Type", "Size", "Length"],
        ["Type A", "25 mm", "100m"],

    ],
    font="Arial",  # Setting a suitable font
)

    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    data=argument2.get("data"),
    font=argument2.get("font")
)
doc = table_adder2.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file

# Extract the rectangles on the target page and order
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
pagenumber = 12
rectangleorder = 0

# Create a dictionary for the first table

table_adder2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument2.get("clip"), data=argument2.get("data"), arrange=argument2.get("arrange"), font=argument2.get("font"), fontsize=argument2.get("fontsize"))

doc = table_adder2.addtable()

rectangleorder1 = 0  # Rectangle 1 corresponds to rectangleorder=0

rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Group 1: Rotate the column and line classes clockwise by 45 degrees using cover mode
argument_group1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    rotation=['r', 45, rfpoint1]
)

argument_group2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle2,
    rotation=['r', 45, rfpoint2]
)

# Initialize vector selector for Group 1

covered_columns1 = selector1.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
covered_lines1 = selector1.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument_group2.get("clip"))
covered_columns2 = selector2.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
covered_lines2 = selector2.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()


# Apply operation to column class

    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument_group1.get("clip"),

    rotation=argument_group1.get("rotation")
)
doc = projector1_columns.project()

projector2_columns = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,

)

)

    doc=doc,

    clip=argument_group2.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines2,
    cdrawings=selector2.selected_lines,
    rotation=argument_group2.get("rotation")
)
doc = projector2_lines.project()

# Group 2: Scale the rebar class to 0.8 size missing selection mode details

instruction: In the file X8JLP3Z.pdf, on page 2, within the third rectangle, move the vector graphics slightly upward and scale them to a somewhat larger size. Apply these operations to the rebar and column classes using the Cover mode selection method.
ground_truth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "X8JLP3Z.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page 2, rectangle 3
pagenumber = 1  # Page 2 corresponds to pagenumber=1 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder = 2  # Rectangle 3 corresponds to rectangleorder=2
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Assume rational values for vague magnitudes
move_up = 10  # Move slightly upward (assumed 10 units)
scale_up = [1.1, 1.1]  # Scale somewhat larger (assumed scale factor 1.1)

# Prepare arguments
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    move=[0, move_up, rfpoint],  # Move upward
    scal=['sc', scale_up , rfpoint]  # Scale larger
)

# Initialize vector selector
selector = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))

# Select rebars and columns using Cover mode
covered_rebars = selector.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
covered_columns = selector.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

# Apply operations to rebars
projector_rebars = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_rebars,
    cdrawings=selector.selected_lines,
    move=argument.get("move"),
    scal=argument.get("scal")
)
doc = projector_rebars.project()

# Apply operations to columns
projector_columns = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_columns,
    cdrawings=selector.selected_lines,
    move=argument.get("move"),
    scal=argument.get("scal")
)
doc = projector_columns.project()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 3
# File 3
filepath = "O345P678.pdf"

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

rectangleorder0 = 1
rectangle0, rfpoint0 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber0, rectangleorder=rectangleorder0)

# Assumed reasonable defaults: Font="Arial", Font Size=12 (moderate), Alignment=center
argument0 = dict(clip=rectangle0, font="Arial", fontsize=12, rotate=90)
Text_manipulator0 = PDFbf.manipulate_text(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber0,
    clip=argument0.get("clip"),
    font=argument0.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument0.get("fontsize"),
    rotate=argument0.get("rotate"),
)

Text_manipulator0.text = Text_manipulator0.deletetext()  # Delete all vertical text

)

doc = Text_manipulator1.addtext()

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "A4ZQP9K.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page 6, rectangle 5
pagenumber = 5  # Page 6 corresponds to pagenumber=5 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder = 4  # Rectangle 5 corresponds to rectangleorder=4
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Assume rational values for vague magnitudes
rotate_clockwise = 15  # Slight clockwise rotation (assumed 15 degrees)
move_right = 10  # Slight rightward shift (assumed 10 units)

# Prepare arguments
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    rotation=['r', rotate_clockwise, rfpoint],  # Rotate slightly clockwise
    move=[move_right, 0, rfpoint]  # Move slightly to the right
)

# Initialize vector selector
selector = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))

# Select lines using Intersect mode
intersected_lines = selector.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

# Apply operations to lines
projector = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=intersected_lines,
    cdrawings=selector.selected_lines,
    rotation=argument.get("rotation"),
    move=argument.get("move")
)
doc = projector.project()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

import fitz

rectangleorder = 7  # Rectangle 8 corresponds to rectangleorder=7

# Prepare arguments
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    scal=['sc', scale_down, rfpoint],  # Scale smaller
    move=[0, move_down, rfpoint]  # Move downward
)

    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_columns,
    cdrawings=selector.selected_lines,
    scal=argument.get("scal"),
    move=argument.get("move")
)
doc = projector.project()

doc.save(updated_filepath)

instruction:
Delete vector graphics in the file "TY37WKL.pdf" as follows:
The classes "line," "rebar," and "column" using Cross mode on page 2, rectangle order 6.
The classes "rebar," "column," and "line" using Window mode on page 3, rectangle order 4 (repair the target position).
ground_truth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Filepath
filepath = "TY37WKL.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Task 1: Line, Rebar, Column, Cross mode, page 2, rectangle 6
pagenumber1 = 1  # Page 2 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder1 = 5
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle1)
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
intersected_lines = selector1.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
intersected_rebars = selector1.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
intersected_columns = selector1.mode2_columns_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

sel_drawings1 = intersected_lines + intersected_rebars + intersected_columns
drawing_manipulator1 = PDFbf.draw_drawer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, listofcdraw=sel_drawings1)
doc = drawing_manipulator1.delete_draw()

# Task 2: Rebar, Column, Line, Window mode, page 3, rectangle 4 (repair)
pagenumber2 = 2  # Page 3 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder2 = 3
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle2)
selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
covered_rebars = selector2.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
covered_columns = selector2.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
covered_lines = selector2.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

sel_drawings2 = covered_rebars + covered_columns + covered_lines
drawing_manipulator2 = PDFbf.draw_drawer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, listofcdraw=sel_drawings2)
doc = drawing_manipulator2.delete_draw()

repairer2 = PDFbf.repairer(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2.get("clip"), cdrawings=selector2.selected_lines, sel_drawings=sel_drawings2)
doc = repairer2.del_repair()

updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "T6PJQ8L.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page 14, rectangle 2
pagenumber = 13  # Page 14 corresponds to pagenumber=13 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder = 1  # Rectangle 2 corresponds to rectangleorder=1
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Assume rational values for vague magnitudes
move_up = 15  # Roughly upward move (assumed 15 units)
rotate_clockwise = 10  # Small clockwise rotation (assumed 10 degrees)

# Prepare arguments
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    move=[0, move_up, rfpoint],  # Move upward
    rotation=['r', rotate_clockwise, rfpoint]  # Rotate clockwise
)

# Initialize vector selector
selector = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))

# Select lines and columns using Cover mode
covered_lines = selector.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
covered_columns = selector.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

# Apply operations to lines
projector_lines = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines,
    cdrawings=selector.selected_lines,
    move=argument.get("move"),
    rotation=argument.get("rotation")
)
doc = projector_lines.project()

# Apply operations to columns
projector_columns = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_columns,
    cdrawings=selector.selected_lines,
    move=argument.get("move"),
    rotation=argument.get("rotation")
)
doc = projector_columns.project()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

# Task 1: Column, Line, Rebar, Window mode, page 7, rectangle 2
